title: Bacon Wrapped Tenderloin with Sage and Lemon

instructions.1: Season pork tenderloins with salt and black pepper.
instructions.2: Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook tenderloins in hot oil until browned on each side, 3 to 5 minutes per side. Remove from heat and cool.
instructions.3: Preheat oven to 380 degrees F (193 degrees C).
instructions.4: Stir juice from 1/2 lemon, sage, and lemon zest together in a bowl until a paste forms; spread paste over each tenderloin.
instructions.5: Wrap bacon strips around each tenderloin and place in a baking dish. Scatter apples around tenderloins and drizzle juice of 2 lemons over meat and apples.
instructions.6: Cook pork in the preheated oven until apples are tender and pork is slightly pink in the center, about 25 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 145 degrees F (63 degrees C).

questions.question: In Step 6, is the apples from Step 5 being used?
Is oven from Step 3 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is apples from Step 5 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is black pepper from Step 1 still available in Step 2?
Is black pepper live after Step 2?
What is the last time interval specified in Step 6?
If we skip Step 5, is it still valid to use the apples in Step 6?
Can we stir (Step 4) and cook (Step 6) at the same time?
